intro: Marrubium procerum, commonly known as the tall horehound, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It has a compact growth habit with upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Marrubium procerum is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
